circle_formation module

A circle formation algorithm for multiple agents.

Author: yyang52 date： 8/25/23

circle_formation.circleFormation(x: ndarray, member_idx_cell: List[int], main_target_pos: ndarray, radius_circle: float, timercount: int, position_uni_clf_controller: Callable[[ndarray, ndarray], ndarray]) → ndarray[source]

Compute the control inputs for multiple agents.

Parameters:

  • x – The current positions of all agents.

  • member_idx_cell – A list containing indices for each group of agents.

  • main_target_pos – The main target positions.

  • radius_circle – The radius of the circle.

  • timercount – A counter for the loop.

  • position_uni_clf_controller – The controller function.

Returns:

The computed control inputs.

\[\theta_{\text{vec}} = \frac{1}{N_m} \times 2\pi \times \text{np.arange}(N_m) + \frac{2\pi}{N_m \times 50} \times \text{timercount}\]
circle_formation.create_clf_unicycle_position_controller(linear_velocity_gain=0.8, angular_velocity_gain=3)[source]

Creates a unicycle model pose controller. Drives the unicycle model to a given position and orientation.

Parameters:

  • linear_velocity_gain – affects how quickly the unicycle approaches the desired position

  • angular_velocity_gain – affects how quickly the unicycle approaches the desired angle

Returns:

The pose_uni_clf_controller_custom function

\[u: \mathbf{R}^{3 \times N} \times \mathbf{R}^{2 \times N} \to \mathbf{R}^{2 \times N}\]
